segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …

segments.pli: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
These are the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā dvinnaṃ phalānaṃ aññataraṃ phalaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ—
segments.en: Because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation, one of two results can be expected:

segments.pli: diṭṭheva dhamme aññā, sati vā upādisese anāgāmitā”ti.
segments.en: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.…

suttaplex.blurb: When the four kinds of mindfulness meditation are developed, perfection or non-return may be expected.
